intro: Ononis alopecuroides subsp. simulata, commonly known as the hairy bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in dry, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
